selection_utils module

selection_utils.get_fitted_models(train_list, n_jobs=8)[source]

Returns the trained model for each train_list dataframe.

Parameters:

  • train_list – List[pd.DataFrame]: training data list

  • n_jobs – int: number of cores for parallel learning

Returns:

List[xgboost.sklearn.XGBRegressor]: list fitted XGBRegressor models

selection_utils.get_importance(models, train_list, mode='all')[source]

Using the built-in feature importance estimation methods within XGBRegressor and the shap algorithm, it calculates the importance of the features on all training data, normalizes and averages them.

Parameters:

  • models – List[xgboost.sklearn.XGBRegressor]: the list of trained models

  • train_list – List[pd.DataFrame]: the list of training data

  • mode – str: importance calculating mode

Returns:

Dict[str, float]: dictionary, its keys are the features from the training data, and the values are the calculated importance

selection_utils.get_stats(blocks, n_jobs=1)[source]

Using statistical criteria, calculates the significance of the features for each block in the list. Then the obtained p_value s are averaged.

Parameters:

  • blocks – List[pd.DataFrame]: list of datas with target column and the same scheme

  • n_jobs – int: the number of cores that can be used in the calculation of stat values

Returns:

pd.DataFrame: df with calculated p_value for each of the attributes

selection_utils.importance_select_features(importance_dict, portion=0.8)[source]

According to the values of the importance of the attributes selects the best of them, which contain the portion % of the importance of all the features.

Parameters:

  • importance_dict – Dict[str, float]: a dictionary with the importance of each feature

  • portion – float: portion of the importance of all the features to be ensured

Returns:

List[Tuple[str, float]]: a minimum number of features, the overall importance of which >= portion

selection_utils.stats_select_features(relevance_table)[source]

Using a table with the statistical significance of each feature, returns only low-correlated relevant features.

It is assumed that the correlated attributes are calls of the same function with different parameters. Therefore, all the features are factorized by the values of the function arguments, and from each class the representative with the lowest p_value is selected. Because the table is sorted by p_value, factorization is easy to implement through a set.

Parameters:

relevance_table – pd.DataFrame: a table with the calculated features and their statistical significance

Returns:

List[str]: a list of names of relevant low-correlated features from relevance_table.
